alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 3:34PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST/745 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following counties, Apache and Navajo. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST /745 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 PM MST /432 PM MDT/, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Big Dam Wash, Jeddito Wash, Steamboat Wash,and Pueblo Colorado Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Steamboat Canyon, Toyei, Cornfields Chapter House, Cornfields, Burnside, Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Greasewood, Ganado. - This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 416 and 448. Highway 191 between mile markers 411 and 419. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
